committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds

official_title: A bill to designate the Federal Building in Oak Ridge, Tennessee, as the "Joe L. Evins Federal Building", to direct the Administrator of General Services to administer 12.5 acres of land adjacent to the building in the same manner as the Administrator administered that land before November 30, 1982, and to designate that land as the "Sam Rayburn Recreational Area".

summary.text: Designates the Federal Building on Administration Road in Oak Ridge, Tennessee, as the Joe L. Evins Federal Building. Requires the Administrator of General Services to administer specified land in a specified manner. Designates such land as the Sam Rayburn Recreational Area.

titles.title: A bill to designate the Federal Building in Oak Ridge, Tennessee, as the "Joe L. Evins Federal Building", to direct the Administrator of General Services to administer 12.5 acres of land adjacent to the building in the same manner as the Administrator administered that land before November 30, 1982, and to designate that land as the "Sam Rayburn Recreational Area".
